reviewText: Kudos....Never expected to see such great entertainment from TV of 50 year ago. I only wish they can duplicate Raymond Burr

Perry Mason, Volume 5 Collector's Edition DVD

The `Perry Mason' show lasted for nine seasons, a record then. Out of its 271 episodes 120 were used for sixty VHS tapes around 1994. Later 108 of these were used for twenty-seven DVD discs in four volumes. In 2006 they started to release the whole series on DVDs, a half-season at a time. The First Season was the best as most of its stories came from Gardner's novels. A [year] identifies the original novel. Starring Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, William Hopper, William Talman, and Ray Collins.

"The Case of the Black-Eyed Blonde" (Jun 14, 1958), [1941]
It begins when a young woman has an argument with her roommate. Does a wealthy man have an unknown grandson? A family conflict leads to a visit to Perry Mason. Lt. Tragg shows up with the news that Diana Reynolds was killed. But it was her roommate Marion Shaw! Perry questions Diana Reynolds about what happened last night. Then Lt. Tragg arrests her. The plot is complicated since the persons involved have no alibi. Anthony Davis testified against Diana. Can Marion Shaw's diary contain a clue? There is a surprise conclusion to this very complicated story. Perry's client is freed as a result. There is a happy ending to this story.

"The Case of the Nervous Accomplice" (Oct 5, 1957), [1955]
It begins when Roxy Howard visits Bruce Granger about an oil well. They also have a romantic relationship. Bruce `s wife knows about this but doesn't want a divorce. The land development company is drilling for oil. Perry Mason's job is to buy into this company and work on his hidden agenda. George Lutts goes to view the property. A shot is heard and Lutts falls dead. Mrs. Sibyl Granger runs off in a panic. A passing taxi takes her away. The pistol in her car has disappeared. Lt. Tragg arrives and takes Mrs. Sibyl Granger in for questioning after Sybil admits to ownership of the gun found by the body. There is drama in the courtroom. Perry and Paul revisit the scene and discover facts about the crime. Perry lays a trap for a nervous accomplice.

"The Case of the One-Eyed Witness" (Feb 22, 1958), [1951]
It starts with people waiting in line for a bus. Mrs. Marian Fargo has been paying blackmail over a secret. An investigator has overheard their conversation and reports to Mr. Gallagher. Mr. Carlin asked Mrs. Fargo to meet him at this apartment. Perry Mason receives a phone call asking him to meet Mr. Carlin and get a file from him. But it doesn't work out. We soon learn why, and about the extortion plot. Perry stakes out Carlin's house; there is an explosion and fire. Paul Drake investigates and gets the name of Fargo. They go there and find a dead man. Marian Fargo is arrested by the police. Mrs. Maynard was on the bus with Mrs. Fargo from Los Angeles. Charles Gallagher visits Perry Mason's office to tell about the secret. There is a conflict over eyewitness identification of Mrs. Fargo. A witness on the stand stumbles over an identification. The result is freedom for Perry's client.
